volunteer_experience.info: I am proud to serve on the board of advisors for the Arabian Hotel Investment Conference (AHIC) by contributing data, knowledge, and contacts. I also have a lot of fun moderating panels and delivering keynotes whenever needed.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Bench Events
volunteer_experience.title: Advisory Board Member - Arabian Hotel Investment Conference

volunteer_experience.info: Conceived and delivered nine TEDx events hosted at the Dubai Community Theatre and Community Centre. The format was an innovation intended to foster dialogue: one topic, one speaker, and a structure designed to nurture audience participation.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: TED Conferences
volunteer_experience.title: Curator

volunteer_experience.info: I was honoured to act as GIST mentor. Two entrepreneur teams I have mentored proceeded to win the awards for the first runner-up and a mention, respectively, at the GIST Tech- i 2012 Competition.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: CRDF Global
volunteer_experience.title: GIST Mentor

volunteer_experience.info: I am honored to play a small role in the creation of a unique platform to connect key stakeholders in the restaurant investment community. The Global Restaurant Investment Forum (GRIF) was launched in February 2014. My role on the advisory board is to help shape the agenda and select key speakers. I also contribute as moderator and keynote speaker when needed (e.g. delivering the annual State of Innovation talk to an audience of restaurant owners, investors, brands and operators).
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Global Restaurant Investment Forum
volunteer_experience.title: Advisory Board Member

volunteer_experience.info: Following participation in MIT Trinity Challenge I was honored to accept an invitation to serve as a member of this Global Panel
volunteer_experience.subtitle: MIT Technology Review
volunteer_experience.title: Global Panel Member

publications: [{"title":"The Case for Enhancing Learning Ecosystems with Elements from Hospitality","subtitle":"Academia.edu","date":"December 6, 2014","description":"Presented at Cambridge University in August 2014, an exploration of opportunities to strengthen education ecosystems by incorporating elements from hospitality."},{"title":"Changing Times Require Changing Hotel Business Models","subtitle":"HVS","date":"June 2, 2009","description":"The performance of the hotel industry can be enhanced by how our business is conceptualised. Here are two ways to redefine hotel business models and create value."},{"title":"Senses of Place","subtitle":"ScholarWorks@UMass Amherst","date":"May 2008","description":"A dissertation on a multi-disciplinary approach to the concept of place, with applications in urban development, smart cities, and hospitality and tourism development strategy."},{"title":"The Virtual Meeting Ground","subtitle":"HVS","date":"October 5, 2007","description":"Why telepresence is a nascent revenue opportunity for upscale and luxury hotels, by leveraging underutilized spaces to enable remote work and global collaboration."}]

projects.title: Nondemics
projects.description: A public-private partnership that enables and incentivizes the medical diagnostics ecosystem to collaborate at unprecedented scale and speed in response to pathogen threats.

projects.title: Onco
projects.description: A network of oncology clinics designed to serve secondary locations in the developing world, piloted in Romania.

projects.title: 50 Chefs
projects.description: On the surface, it's a culinary travel platform designed for investors who enjoy meeting over good food and drinks. At its core, it marks the initial steps towards enlisting the dining community in a long-term research project. This project aims to explore the brain-gut connection using real-time data.

projects.title: Innovation Norway
projects.description: Supported the internationalization efforts of Norwegian companies in the Middle East, under a two-year public-private partnership with Innovation Norway, a state-owned company and a national development bank formed in 2004 through the merger of four governmental organizations.

Fifty Productions
projects.description: Started with the intent to support 50 Chefs - created customer experiences, captured them on film, and shared them online, where memories live and desire is born. In 2019 changed focus to video ethnography: long-form interviews capturing the people and ideas shaping the evolution of Dubai. Eventually morphed into the Media Lab concept, designed to be implemented within a global management consulting company, with impact on seven distinct business functions.

projects.title: LifeNudge
projects.description: Won semi-finalist spot at the 7th MIT Enterprise Forum Arab Startup Competition in 2014 with a health care mobile app delivering behavioural nudges and enabling peer pressure to improve medication adherence in chronically ill patients.
